channel.title: Morning Mail
channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: Planning to Graduate This December?
item.description: If you plan to graduate in December 2024 and haven’t completed your degree application yet, the Student Information System (SIS) is now open to apply! The application deadline is Friday, October 11. Please make sure you refer to the Registrar’s Graduation & Commencement webpage for complete details!
item.author: Students

item.title: SWE to Hold Professional General Body Meeting with Anne Ryan
item.description: Date: Thursday, October 10, 2024 5:30 PM - 6:30 PM - Join the Society of Women Engineers for a resume workshop hosted by the decorated conference speaker Anne Ryan! She will be joining us online, and you can attend either in the Shelnutt Gallery (room 3606) in the Rensselaer Union or via Webex!
item.author: Students

item.title: “Where Pride Meets Progress” Event to Feature Stories from RPI Alum
item.description: Join the Center for Career and Professional Development on October 11 at 4:00PM EST in DCC 318 for an inviting LGBTQ+ panel, where current RPI students will have an opportunity to hear from RPI alum who identify as part of the LGBTQ+ community. Panelists will join virtually and feature a diverse range of voices, representing different industries and career paths, as they share their personal and professional journeys.
item.author: Students

item.title: SoE Hub to Host Industry Hour on October 7
item.description: Date: Monday, October 7, 2024 6:00 AM - 7:00 AM - Join the SoE Hub for a discussion with former and current students to learn about Nuclear Engineering, career opportunities, internships/co-ops, research, and student experience.
item.author: Students

item.title: Davies Medal for Engineering Achievement Ceremony to be Held October 7
item.description: Date: Monday, October 7, 2024 4:00 PM - 5:30 PM - RSVP to join Rensselaer and the School of Engineering as they present the Davies Medal for Engineering Achievement to distinguished School of Engineering alum Nicholas T. Pinchuk ’68, ’69G, Chairman and CEO of Snap-on Incorporated. The award ceremony will include a presidential conversation between RPI President Schmidt and Mr. Pinchuk, and will be followed by a reception.
item.author: Community

item.title: “Works in Sensing and Feeling” Topic of Talk with Artist Constantina Zavitsanos
item.description: Date: Tuesday, October 8, 2024 6:00 PM - Join EMPAC for a talk from artist Constantina Zavitsanos, whose work ranges from sculpture to performance, and deals with debt and dependency, entropy, thresholds of perception, incapacity, and modes of sensing and feeling. This presentation concludes curator Katherine C.M. Adams’s Decommission series.
item.author: Community

item.title: ECSE Seminar Series to Continue October 9
item.description: Date: Wednesday, October 9, 2024 4:00 PM - 5:00 PM - Join ECSE for a seminar titled “Co-design of Quantum Software and Hardware: a Hybrid Classical - Quantum Approach” with Assistant Professor Zhiding Liang of Rensselaer’s Computer Science department.
item.author: Community

item.title: Rensselaer at Work to Hold Information Session October 11
item.description: Date: Friday, October 11, 2024 12:00 PM - 12:30 PM - Register to join Rensselaer at Work Dean Aric Krause, Ph. D., as he reviews Rensselaer’s online, project-based graduate degrees and certificates, and describes how RPI Instructor Mentors provide industry expertise, advice, and mentorship in a targeted and experiential learning environment.
item.author: Community

item.title: Gross Selected as American Chemical Society Fellow
item.description: Rensselaer’s Richard Gross, Ph.D., Constellation Chair of Biocatalysis and Metabolic Engineering, has been selected as a member of the 2024 class of Fellows of the American Chemical Society (ACS). The ACS Fellows Program honors members “for their outstanding achievements in and contributions to the science and the profession and for their equally exemplary service to the Society;” Gross is one of 37 members earning the distinction this year.
item.author: Community

item.title: Faculty Recommendations for NSF GRFP Due October 11
item.description: Date: Friday, October 11, 2024 5:00 PM - Rensselaer faculty should note that NSF GRFP is requiring letters of recommendation to be submitted early this year — by Friday, October 11 — although student applications are not due until October 15-18. Faculty members who are writing letters should have received an email from NSF with instructions on how to submit them, but may contact Betty Madigan with any questions.
item.author: Faculty and Staff

item.title: TIAA Offering Confidential In-Person Retirement Counseling October 17
item.description: Date: Thursday, October 17, 2024 8:30 AM - 4:30 PM - A TIAA Financial Consultant will be available for one-on-one consultations on a broad range of retirement topics. Attend this upcoming event to help you become better informed and more confident about Rensselaer’s retirement plan benefits!
item.author: Faculty and Staff

item.title: Flu, COVID Vaccines Available for Faculty and Staff October 4
item.description:
In partnership with Rensselaer’s Division of Human Resources, Adirondack Health & Wellness is once again administering this year’s free flu and COVID-19 vaccine clinics. The first opportunity is this Friday, October 4 from 9am-3pm in the lower level of the Heffner Alumni House, so sign up for your flu and/or Moderna COVID-19 vaccines now!

For information about sharing your news or events, or to change your subscription settings, visit morningmail.rpi.edu.
